execute

public void execute()
The process here is either delegated or executed on the interpeter.

Specified by:
execute in interface IveProcess

stop

public void stop()
          throws ProcessNotRunningException
Stops the process. This does not mean, that the process is stopped after return from this function. The process is stopped when it signals on the FinishHook. This may (but does not have to) occur during execution of this method.

Specified by:
stop in interface IveProcess
Throws:
ProcessNotRunningException

getFinishHook

public FinishHook getFinishHook()

getFinishHook in interface IveProcess
Returns:
process finish hook

getExpandHook

public Hook getExpandHook()
Retrieves Hook which is signaled when the process has to be expanded. When the process becomes non-atomic due to a LOD change.

Specified by:
getExpandHook in interface IveProcess
Returns:
process expand hook

getShrinkHook

public Hook getShrinkHook()
Retrieves Hook which is signaled when the process has to be shrunk. When the process becomes atomic due to a LOD change.

Specified by:

Returns:
process shrink hook

expand

public void expand()
Called by an Interpreter when the process should be expanded. When the process becames non-atomic due to a LOD change.

Specified by:
